review: I probably should have done more research, but I'm glad I bought an Amazon Fire Stick on the same order.The Chromecast doesn't *do* anything.While other HDMI stick products are able to stand alone and stream content to your TV, the Chromecast can not. All the Chromecast can do is display the content on your device. If you want to watch anything using this device, you need to tie up your computer/phone/tablet/Chrombook to do the work.This might be nice for Google Apps sites to display content from Google devices, it really isn't a functional solution for streaming content unless you've got a spare device lying around that can do the work.

review: I got this device because I watch plenty of Youtube videos, but my smart bluray player constantly freezes when watching them.  This was a way for me to be able to queue up videos and not worry about any problems (thinking the hardware, software, and network is all Google).  Unfortunately, I am still having freezes in the videos only solved by restarting the chromecast.  To do this I have to open the app on the phone, press restart, wait two minutes, and then select my video again.  This is not a solution to the problem which prompted me to buy the device, and results in my rating of 3 stars.  I hope Google gets this sorted out, for as I said, they are in control of the entire data pipeline and I would expect it to run smoothly.
